column4: i keep getting an error when trying to install a plugin in pidgin http://pastie.org/1396893
you likely need to install libnotify-dev
instead of just libnotify? or in place of libnotify?
you need both, one is just the library, the -dev package has headers needed to link programs to the library
ok ill try installing the dev and see if that solves the compiling problem then, thx
dammit. now its telling me that i need checking for PIDGIN... configure: error: Package requirements (pidgin >= 2.0.0) were not met:
but i have pidgin, its even open right now
im not understanding this at all
when you compile software, you need the -dev packages for program, that provide necessary header files to compile, in this case pidgin-dev
the headers are kept in a separate package from the programs and libraries because most people don't need them
r00t4rd3d, im tryin to get pidgins libnotify to work
so i should get the pidgin-dev package from synaptic?
you shouldn't need to compile anything for that, libnotify support is included by default
i was changing the notify package to display differently
yes, or: sudo apt-get install pidgin-dev;
thx ill try again nd see if it works this time
